<https://twitter.com/simonpj0|@simonpj0>: I'm delighted that Excel now supports first-class, lexically scoped lambda-expressions.  Excel just became a Turing-complete programming language!
<https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/blog/lambda-the-ultimatae-excel-worksheet-function/>

text: Maybe now we can all decide excel was a fun experiment and it's time to put it to rest.

elements.text: Maybe now we can all decide excel was a fun experiment and it's time to put it to rest.

text:
Nooo spreadsheets are amazing.
I almost never use them but they are probably the single most popular programming environment.
They have tricked billions of people into being programmers without knowing it.

Further they are the original reactive programming environment.
Pluto.jl is basically a funny shaped spreadsheet.

text: Okay I respect your opinion. But - its the wrong paradigm. Put the code forward and hide the data. Not show me piles of data and atomize all the code.

elements.text: Okay I respect your opinion. But - its the wrong paradigm. Put the code forward and hide the data. Not show me piles of data and atomize all the code.

text: For reference: whitespace (<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whitespace_(programming_language)>) is also turing complete. I'm not celebrating anytime soon
